article:
When my son, Mark, was in the third grade, he saved all his pocket money for over three months to buy holiday presents for those he loved. He had   _  twenty dollars.
     The third Saturday in December, Mark said he had   _  his list and had his money in his  _  . I drove him to a  _  supermarket. Mark picked up
a hand basket and went off on his own  _  I waited patiently
reading a book at the front of the store. It  _  Mark over 45
minutes to choose his presents. When he came up to the checkout  , the smile on his face was truly   _  . The clerk rang up his purchase as I  _  looked at
the other way. Mark kept  within  his budget   and   reached  into his
pocket for his money.  _  was not there! There was a hole in
his pocket, but no money. Mark stood  in the middle of  the store holding
his basket, with tears rolling down his cheeks. His whole body was  _  with
his sobs  . Then a(n)   _  thing
happened. A  _  shopping in the store came up to Mark. She
knelt down and took him  _  her arms. "You would do me the
favor if you let me  _  your money," said the woman. "It
would be the most wonderful present you could ever give me. I only ask you
could  pass it on  . One day, when you grow up, I would like you to
find someone you can help. I know you feel as good about it  _  I
do now when you do help other people." Mark took the money, tried to dry his  _  and ran to the checkout as fast as he could.
